derivation: from an unused root meaning to be brilliant;
outline:
1. sun
    1. sun
    2. sunrise, sun-rising, east, sun-setting, west (of direction)
    3. sun (as object of illicit worship)
    4. openly, publicly (in other phrases)
    5. pinnacles, battlements, shields (as glittering or shining)
kjv_def: [phrase] east side(-ward), sun (rising), [phrase] west(-ward), window. See also H1053 (בֵּית שֶׁמֶשׁ).
strongs_def: the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
